data.title: Love the course.
data.text: I always liked the course, but with the re-do of the greens and the redesign of about 4 holes, I really like it.

data.title: Goffing at Country Club of Coral Springs
data.text: I played a round of golf at Coral Springs Country Club several months ago and had a great time. The course is challenging but not too difficult for the average duffer. The staff in the pro shop and the starter were friendly and helpful pointing out certain approaches to narrow or shallow greens. I have played several rounds there in the past and will play there in the future.

data.title: Good golf
data.text: You can play here without a membership. The grounds are keep well. Has a bar and restaurant for after play.

data.title: Not true!
data.text: The comments made by Katie G. are simply NOT TRUE! Nobody contacted me to apologize personally, and the partial refund for the uncooked hors d'oeuvres which NOBODY could eat was issued begrudgingly.  We were NEVER provided with any linen napkins at the event.  There was NO TIME allowed for photographing the cake, we had to hunt somebody down to cut it and when it came back the crown topper was missing, but I didn't notice until too late -- I was busy entertaining my guests which should have been the only thing I was doing after paying $4K for the Country Club to throw the party.  Everybody had a great time because of the DJ and the company -- no credit whatsoever goes to the Country Club!

data.title: Stay away!!!
data.text: The pictures and previous reviews in 2014 or earlier clearly did not play the same course I played today. How can you charge $52 on a course that is in complete disrepair? Not a single green was actually green(more like brown). In fact, you're lucky if they have grass. It has a nice layout but really saddens me to see a course in this kind of condition.  The starter later told us they were planning on closing it down for some time to rebuild it. Probably why they haven't maintained it for some time so why charge the same fees other courses are charging? Stay away!

data.title: for the money a decent round of golf
data.text: have played here for the past two winters, through golf now you're able to get on the course for $40. my opinion of the course would be higher but for unknown reasons the second hole which is a fairly straight forward par 3 always has a 3 to 4 foursome backup which easily adds a 1/2 to your round, yes it's nice to sit there in the sun but the wait is ridiculous. otherwise course & greens in decent shape & a nice place to play, oh the other odd thing is the beer cart girl just keeps driving by with no effort to stop & ask if u want anything, guess she doesn't need the tips!

data.title: Hope for a Reno
data.text: Course dated, poor greens. Saw drink cart drive past us twice, but no chance for water, beer, etc. And no bathrooms on course, which could have been an issue if we'd had anything to drink. Guarantee of four hour round proved to be farcical, as no Marshall to keep slow groups moving. Try somewhere else.

data.title: Greens are tore up!
data.text:
Overall I love the layout of this course.  I found a great deal here on Golf Now and decided to call the course before booking to check the conditions.  I was told course was in great shape and I asked about the greens and was told they were in good shape as well. 

I play between 75-100 rounds a year and these greens were the absolute worst I ever played on!  The course took on quite a bit of water in November and they are still trying to repair.  Standing grass seed and huge dead patches in every green.  

I'm not knocking the course b/c it is a nice one, but don't lie to your customers when they call to get a course condition update prior to booking...that's just bad business.

I went into the clubhouse to let them know that I was disappointed that I was mislead and only got a "sorry" out of it.  Needless to say I won't be bringing any more clients here!

Very disappointed that I was mislead and that they showed no remorse and didn't try to make it right!

owner_response.author: Katie G, Guest Relations Manager at The Country Club of Coral Springs, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Travis, 

It was a pleasure speaking with you. I truly appreciate your feelings about communicating the correct message to the customer. As we discussed I met with my staff explaining the importance of the customer message and exactly how and why it is important to provide an honest evaluation of product condition. I was very happy to hear that your customer service experience with the outside staff and food & beverage was excellent. Again, I truly apologize about yesterday, and I’m pleased that once our greens are up to standards that you are willing to give us another chance. I will personally stay in touch both by phone and e mail when the greens are ready offering you that complimentary foursome. Our goal is to have 100% positive feedback from our customers, accordingly I’m confident that your next visit will allow us to have you reverse your last post. Again, thank you for your time and comments.        

Bill Friesing
General Manager, CCofCS
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: DO NOT Plan Your Party Here!
data.text: Had a surprise birthday party for my husband with 40 guests, and after a questionable tasting with promises of a perfect event, I went ahead and booked because the price was right - BAD CHOICE!!!  The food and service were horrible!  The raspberry & brie hors d'oeuvres were not even cooked and they refused to refund my money even after admitting that they "came straight out of the refrigerator"! Also, there were no napkins on the tables. When I asked the server for napkins for my guests she handed me a stack of cocktail napkins. When it came time for the cake, I had to track down a server to cut and serve it and then they did not return my very special cake topper and now say that it was disposed of. They did not even apologize for their mistakes.  DON'T BOOK YOUR PARTY HERE!

owner_response.author: Katie G, Manager at The Country Club of Coral Springs, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Rebecca,

We sincerely apologize for any shortcomings that you feel as though your event had.  We did, in fact, send you a check for a partial refund for the hors d’Oeuvres that you were unhappy with.  During your event, when more napkins were requested, a personnel from the wait staff handed out linen napkins individually to each guest.  Napkins were also provided on your buffet table, for guests to pick up as they toured the buffet.  

As with each event, we allow ample time for photographs to be taken of and with the specialty cake, which was explained during this time.  As for the plastic crown cake topper, we would be happy to reimburse your for charges you may have incurred or purchase a new one for you.  You had stated in an email that “In spite of the foregoing, however, the majority of our guests, including the birthday boy, truly enjoyed themselves and had no complaints.”  We would once again like to extend our sincerest apologies.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Challenging golf course with well manicured greens.
data.text: This golf course has been around for a long time but they maintain it wonderfully!  It plays long from the blyes and has some challeging holes.  You will not be disappointed!!  It is busy during the winter season so call a few days ahead for tee times.  You will enjoy your round at this golf course.  They have a driving range, so come warm up and then tee up!!

data.title: Country Club
data.text: The facility still looks great from the outside. They need to remodel inside. In the past 25 years the food has went from very, very good; to they don't even serve that style of cooking. I had a cheese burger w/ fries, beer, for lunch. Cost $$

data.title: Great course! Great value
data.text: This is a very nice course in great condition. It's a lot fun and a really great value for the money. Unfortunately the course has received a lot of rain over the past few weeks so it's really soft. Other than that, I had a lot of fun playing it and will do so again.

data.title: Superb
data.text: We were lucky enough to attend a friends party recently and we were impressed!  The food was delicious.  Delicious enough that four members of our table commented on it.  The help was attentive and more than pleasant. The buffet was fresh, well stocked and plentiful.  Thank you all for a delightful evening.  Kudos to the staff and managers!

data.title: Golf Course nice - food not.....
data.text: Play golf but avoid the food. The golf course is in terrific condition and the kitchen should be closed. The bar is very good but eating there is a risk.

owner_response.author: Katie G, Manager at The Country Club of Coral Springs, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. I would like to extend our sincerest apologies for the experience that you may have had that was not satisfactory. We strive to give our guests the most memorable experience that we can. I welcome you contacting me directly at 954-752-4500 ext 206. I would like to extend lunch on us the next time that you play here; we will do whatever we can to make your next visit a very enjoyable experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best in Broward
data.text: I have been a member of the Country Club of Coral Springs for 8 years and the course is in the best shape since I have been here. New ownership/management has done a nice job making constant improvements including new greens, new tee boxes, re-aligned and improved fairways, improvements in food and beverage and an upgrade in overall staff. We have many choices for golf in South Florida but have remained at CCCS for the friendly group of players along with a solid golf value and great venue!

data.title: Good Time
data.text: I played at Country Club of Coral Springs on Wednesday for the 1st time in about 3 years. Wow! I couldn't believe the great changes they made since I was here last. The greens seem to be new and rolled nicely and the fairways were in great shape. I carry a 15 handicap and our group played the whites at the suggestion of the pro shop. That seemed to fit our group perfectly and the pace was good for this time of year. Much quicker than what we have experienced the past couple months anyway. We will be back! Thanks Joey from Boca

data.title: Members Only
data.text: I just had one of the most bizarre experience I've ever had at The Country Club of Coral Springs. We were on time for a 8:15 tee time and ready to tee off as a group of 4 foursomes pulled up. They had just 1 tee time for all 4 of their groups. As the starter attempted to resolve the confusion, the member in charge of this group stated very loudly that he is a member and the non-members would have to wait. Instead of trying to defuse and resolve this testy situation general manager, Bill Friesing, decided to escalate an already tense situation by stating loud and clear to everyone that members have complete priority over any non-member at this semi-private club. The arrogance of the member and the show that Mr. Friesing was putting on was surprising and classless. Beware that if you attempt to play this course that your tee time may be bumped and delayed until the member gets all of his groups off. Mr. Friesing will make sure that he and his staff will treat the non-members as second class and not important to his business.

owner_response.author: Katie G, Manager at The Country Club of Coral Springs, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
While our goal is to give everyone a great golfing experience, as a semi-private club, we also have a superior obligation to our Members (The Value of Membership) to provide them with preferential service just as is done with an Elite Platinum Member of an airline or a Platinum Member of Amex, etc.  Also, while this one incident did occur on this particular Saturday, we served over 140 non-member golfers that day and had an overwhelming super majority of very happy visitors.  Notwithstanding all of that, we (The Club Owner and General Manager) reviewed our policies and procedures, discussed the matter with our Members who were involved and implemented a more stringent set of Member Throw-in Tee Time Booking Requirements that we believe will prevent such an incident from occurring in the future.

We are in the hospitality business and take customer service very seriously.  Our starter tried to do the right thing by allowing the guest group to tee off number 10 tee but was unable to do so due to maintenance. We’d like to point out that the gentleman and his group were offered a refund and/or complimentary foursome.  He received the refund immediately along with our sincerest apologies.  The complimentary round of golf is still available and, as the owner, I would like to buy the gentleman and his golf guests lunch and a round of drinks. Please contact kgrimmer@vantagehopsitality.com and we’d be more than happy to accommodate you and your golf guests. 

Bernie Moyle, Owner
Bill Friesing, General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ladies Day
data.text: Enjoyable round of golf.  Greens you can 2-putt on make for a friendly challenge between players.  Course was in great shape and the staff was helpful and courteous.  This ladies foursome will be back.

data.title: Coral Springs Hiddem Gem
data.text: This is the best course I've played. My group plays courses in Palm Beach & Broward County and this place is the best value for the money. The service from the moment we arrived and the conditions of the course are great. The greens are the best of any course we have played in both counties. Keep it going Coral Springs, you make golfing fun again and definitely worth the value.

data.title: Great place to play
data.text: Our foursome travels to different courses and we made a tee time and played this past Saturday. Beginning with the bag staff and continuing with the pro shop and cart girl everyone could not have been nicer. The fairways and rough were in very good shape and the greens were in excellent shape, Probably the best greens I have played in the past six months. Lastly no two holes are alike and its one of the best laid out tracks in So. Fl. With a 10:00 am tee time we were expecting the typical  5 hour round. We finished in 4:20.  Our experience was worth sharing and we will definitely become regulars at this course.
